oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Geological Map of the State of Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Maps; Agriculture
Agriculture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Map of Tennessee referring to the mineral and agricultural resources of the state, featuring a table of the geological formations of the state, as well as an inset map of Tennessee copper mines. Shows location of furnaces, rolling mills, forges, and marble quarries.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: James M. Safford
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The creator of this map, James M. Safford (1822-1907), was apppointed state geologist of Tennessee in 1854 and held this position until 1899. His classic work, "The Geology of Tennessee," was published in 1869 and was later adapted as a secondary school textbook.
